TextView.android:text: 30 Days Meal Ideas
Meal ideas for when you don't know what to cook. \nConsists of Breakfast, Lunch, or Dinner ideas.
Day 1: Pork Sinigang
A comforting and delicious Filipino sour soup.
Day 2: Spaghetti Aglio e Olio
A simple pasta recipe with a hint of garlic.
Day 3: Sauteed Zucchini
A quick and healthy dish made by cooking tender zucchini slices in olive oil with garlic, offering a light, savory flavor.
Day 4: Bibimbap
A Korean dish consisting of white rice topped with various vegetables and fried egg, mixed with gochujang sauce.
Day 5: Caesar Salad
A healthy salad dish consisting of romaine lettuce, croutons, Parmesan cheese, and Caesar dressing.
Day 6: Chicken Adobo
A Filipino dish with marinated chicken (or pork) cooked in soy sauce, vinegar, and garlic.
Day 7: Chopsuey
A vibrant stir-fried vegetable dish often mixed with meat or seafood.
Day 8: Doenjang Jigae
A hearty Korean stew made with fermented soybean paste (doenjang), tofu, vegetables, and sometimes meat or seafood, offering a rich, savory, and umami-packed flavor.
Day 9: Chicken Cordon Bleu
A classic breaded chicken dish stuffed with ham and cheese, baked or fried to golden perfection.
Day 10: Munggo Soup
A Filipino dish made from sauteed mung beans simmered with garlic, onions, and tomatoes, often combined with pork or shrimp and leafy greens, resulting in a hearty, flavorful, and nutritious stew.
Day 11: Tortang Talong
Made from grilled eggplants, peeled and dipped in scrambled eggs then pan-fried until golden brown, and best paired with banana ketchup and warm rice.
Day 12: Chicken Macaroni Soup or Sopas
A hearty soup consisting of vegetables, chicken and macaroni, combined with a flavorful broth often enriched with evaporated milk.
Day 13: Ginisang Upo
A simple dish consisting of sauteed bottle gourd (upo) mixed with ground pork.
Day 14: Kimchi Fried Rice
A flavorful dish made by stir-frying leftover rice, mixed with kimchi, Spam, and vegetables, often topped with fried egg.
Day 15: Chicken Wrap
A simple, quick healthy dish consisting of pan-fried chicken, romaine lettuce, tomatoes and dressing, wrapped in a tortilla, perfect for on-the-go dining or as a snack.
Day 16: Ratatouille
A classic French dish made from sauteed eggplants, zucchini, bell pepper and tomatoes in olive oil, resulting in a homey and flavorful vegetable stew.
Day 17: Sinigang na Salmon Belly

Made with tender salmon belly cooked in a tangy broth flavored with tamarind and enriched with a variety of vegetables, such as radish, eggplant, and water spinach, creating a comforting and delicious dish.
Day 18: Garlic Parmesan Wings
Chicken wings fried to golden perfection, coated in buttery goodness and garlic, topped with parmesan cheese.
Day 19: Kimchi Jigae
A Korean stew consisting of Kimchi, pork belly and tofu, offering comfort and warmth perfect for cold days.
Day 20: Creamy Mushroom Chicken
A rich and savory dish consisting of pan-fried chicken with sauteed mushrooms cooked in a rich, creamy sauce, topped with herbs and best eaten with warm rice.
Day 21: Pinakbet

A traditional Filipino dish consisting of various vegetables, such as ampalaya, squash, okra, string beans and eggplant, simmered in bagoong, often mixed with pork, creating a nutritious and flavorful dish.
Day 22: Honey Garlic Chicken Wings
Fried chicken wings coated in a rich sauce consisting of honey, garlic, butter and soy sauce, creating a savory taste, garnished with parsley or onion leaves.
Day 23: Lugaw

A Filipino rice porridge made from simmering rice in broth until it reaches a thick consistency, served with hard-boiled egg, fried garlic and patis (fish sauce), garnished with onion leaves, creating a warm and comfoting dish.
Day 24: Pork Giniling
Made from stir-frying ground pork in soy sauce, often adding vegetables such as potatoes and carrots to create a savory meal, best paired with white rice.
Day 25: Mushroom Soup
A creamy, savory soup made from sauteed mushrooms blended with broth and cream, flavored with garlic, onions and herbs, resulting in a rich and comforting soup perfect for a rainy day.
Day 26: Sinigang na Bangus
A Filipino sour soup with bangus as the main protein, flavored with vegetables and tamarind, creating a tangy and comforting flavor.
Day 27: Sisig

A popular Filipino dish made from chopped and seasoned parts of grilled or boiled pork, typically the face and ears, mixed with onions and chili peppers, served sizzling on a hot plate, and often garnished with a squeeze of calamansi.
Day 28: Stir Fried Tofu Bean Sprouts

A quick vegetarian dish feauring stir fried bean sprouts with tofu, often sauteed with vegetables such as beans and carrots along with soy sauce, enjoyed with rice as it delivers a delighftul combination of flavors.
Day 29: Tinola
A traditional Filipino dish made with chicken, ginger and a flavorful broth, enriched with green papaya or sayote and leafy vegetebales such as malunggay, creating a warm and comfoting dish.
Day 30: Tuna Pesto Pasta
A quick pasta dish made by tossing al dente pasta with canned tuna, pesto sauce, enhanced with garlic and parmesan cheese, resulting in a filling and flavorful dish.
